pr_title: Issue 5395: SLTS - Allow parallel/non-sequential read operations.

timeline.message:
Issue 5395: SLTS - Allow parallel/non-sequential read operations.

Signed-off-by: Sachin Joshi <sachin.joshi@emc.com>

timeline.bodyText: It looks like the segmentNames argument is not used.
timeline.author: eolivelli
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -753,6 +754,30 @@ private void release(String... segmentNames) {
         }
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Executes the given Callable asynchronously and concurrently.
+     * It returns a CompletableFuture that will be completed with the result.
+     * The operations are assumed to be independent of other operations.
+     *
+     * @param operation    The Callable to execute.
+     * @param <R>       Return type of the operation.
+     * @param segmentNames The names of the Segments involved in this operation (for sequencing purposes).
+     * @return A CompletableFuture that, when completed, will contain the result of the operation.
+     * If the operation failed, it will contain the cause of the failure.
+     * */
+    private <R> CompletableFuture<R> executeParallel(Callable<CompletableFuture<R>> operation, String... segmentNames) {

timeline.bodyText:
Why so you need to start the computation this way?
Why not just submitting the operation to the thread pool?
The weird fact is that the operation returns a CompletableFuture so we may expect it to be already an asynchronous operation (but probably this is not always the case?)
timeline.author: eolivelli

replies.bodyText:
I didn't find any equivalent to CompletableFuture::ComposeAsync().
We definitely want to run this method and lambda supplied on storage thread pool and not on core thread pool.
replies.author: sachin-j-joshi

replies.bodyText: Use CompletableFuture.runAsync or CompletableFuture.supplyAsync, and inside that you execute your code. It's much simpler and more elegant.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu

replies.bodyText:
CompletableFuture.supplyAsync can't compose.

Required type: CompletableFuture<R>
Provided: CompletableFuture<CompletableFuture<R>>

no instance(s) of type variable(s) exist so that CompletableFuture<R> conforms to R inference variable U has incompatible bounds: equality constraints: R lower bounds: CompletableFuture<R>
replies.author: sachin-j-joshi

replies.bodyText: OK, let's file a follow-up issue to clean this class up for the next release.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu
